title.narrative: 6.4 EMERGENCY CP RESPONSE

description.narrative: 6.4 By 2019 relevant MDAs, Local Councils, partners and communities have the capacity to provide emergency child protection interventions, care and support to children and communities especially those affected by Ebola., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6.0 Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.4 By 2019 relevant MDAs, Local Councils, partners and communities have the capacity to provide emergency child protectioninterventions, care and support to children and communities especially those affected by Ebola.

description.narrative: A strategy on Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS) in Emergencies for Sierra Leone (2019-2021) was formally launched, for improving the capacity of the Ministries, Departments and Agencies, local councils, partners and communities to provide emergency child protection interventions. 30,000 adolescents benefited from activities to promote peace and stability, as well as their empowerment and protection. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
